author: Loch Martin
title: The Raptor
descript: Small carnivorous dinosaurs from the Late Cretaceous period.
para: Velociraptor is a genus of small dromaeosaurid dinosaurs that lived in Asia during the Late Cretaceous epoch, about 75 million to 71 million years ago.
Two species are currently recognized, although others have been assigned in the past.
The type species is V. mongoliensis, named and described in 1924.

author: Isaac Asimov
title: Foundation
descript: A visionary mathematician predicts the fall of an empire and establishes a Foundation to preserve knowledge.
para: In the not-too-distant future, humanity has spread across the galaxy, creating a vast interstellar empire.
Hari Seldon, a brilliant mathematician, predicts the fall of this empire and establishes the Foundation to preserve knowledge and shorten the dark ages that will follow.

author: Agatha Christie
title: Murder on the Orient Express
descript: A detective must solve a murder mystery on a luxurious train.
para: Hercule Poirot finds himself aboard the luxurious Orient Express train, where a murder has taken place.
With a train full of suspects and an alibi for each one, Poirot must use his keen detective skills to solve the mystery.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Lord of the Rings
descript: A hobbit embarks on a perilous journey to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.
para: Frodo Baggins, a hobbit from the Shire, embarks on a perilous journey to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth from the dark lord Sauron.
Along the way, he is joined by a fellowship of diverse characters, each with their own strengths and weaknesses.

author: Margaret Atwood
title: The Handmaid's Tale
descript: A woman navigates an oppressive dystopian society while planning her escape.
para: Set in a dystopian future where a totalitarian regime has overthrown the United States government, women are subjugated and treated as property.
Offred, a handmaid, navigates this oppressive society while secretly planning her escape.

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: The Notebook
descript: A couple's romance faces challenges amid societal expectations and war.
para: In 1940s South Carolina, a young couple, Noah Calhoun and Allie Hamilton, fall deeply in love.
However, their romance is cut short by societal expectations and the outbreak of World War II.
Years later, they reunite and rediscover the passion they once shared.

author: Stephen King
title: The Shining
descript: A man's sanity unravels in a haunted hotel during a winter caretaking job.
para: Jack Torrance, an aspiring writer and recovering alcoholic, takes a job as the winter caretaker of the Overlook Hotel.
As the hotel becomes snowbound, Jack's sanity begins to unravel, and the malevolent forces within the hotel threaten his family.

author: Gillian Flynn
title: Gone Girl
descript: A man becomes the prime suspect in his wife's disappearance, unraveling secrets.
para: On the morning of their fifth wedding anniversary, Nick Dunne's wife, Amy, disappears without a trace.
As the police and media swarm in, Nick becomes the prime suspect in her disappearance.
But as secrets unravel, the truth becomes more elusive.

author: Walter Isaacson
title: Steve Jobs
descript: A biography detailing the life and innovations of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs.
para: This biography of Steve Jobs, the co-founder of Apple Inc., provides a deep dive into his life, from his upbringing in California to his rise as one of the most influential figures in technology.
It explores his visionary leadership and the impact of his innovations.

author: Tina Fey
title: Bossypants
descript: A humorous and insightful memoir of comedian Tina Fey's life and career.
para: Tina Fey's memoir offers a humorous and insightful look into her life and career.
From her childhood in Pennsylvania to her days as head writer for Saturday Night Live and beyond, Fey shares personal anecdotes and behind-the-scenes stories with her signature wit.
